data.title: Exception thrown when trying to rollback to the start of the script twice
data.body:
Renpy allows rollbacking to an arbitrary point in the text history by doing _RollbackToIdentifier(h.rollback_identifier)_, where h is a member of _history_list. However, if you rollback that way to the first line in the script then try to do it a second time, the following exception will be thrown:
![lo0tgh](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12227163/25762253/f57b8ce4-31d5-11e7-9413-972c566c3aba.png)

Doesn't matter how many times you roll forward between the first and second rollback, it will always error out. Successive rollbacks to other points in the script have no problem.

data.title: Update movie.rst
data.body: fix typo

data.title: Improvement: Better error message for missing dynamic images
data.body:
Right now missing files for dynamic images result in errors like this
```File "renpy/common/000statements.rpy", line 385, in execute_pause
    renpy.pause()
IOError: Couldn't find file 'Characters/Emily/portrait/em_[em.outfit]_[em.pose].png'.
```
It's good enough to identify image object but not sufficient to understand what was expected file name.
I suggest to also include evaluated image path too. So error message for missing file would look like
```
IOError: Couldn't find file 'Characters/Emily/portrait/em_black_angry.png' for image 'Characters/Emily/portrait/em_[em.outfit]_[em.pose].png'.
```

data.title: "Ren'py has stopped working" when trying to run .exe
data.body: Title pretty much says it all. I use Windows 10 and am trying to run the latest version of Ren'py (6.99.12.4.2187, to be exact). If any other details or info are needed, let me know please. I want to get back to coding!! ;_;

data.title: The mouse is not shown if exits is clicked during full-screen video.
style default: properties changes transform behavior
data.body:
Sorry I couldn't make a simple demo to replicate this bug. But I confirmed when I use:

    style default:
        properties gui.text_properties()

My transform's animations become buggy, as if sprite's positions are reset before promoting new animation.
When I commented out this line, my transforms work as expected.
Do you have any idea why this line changes transform behavior?

data.title: Exception when using the character ctc parameter and having also a ctc screen
data.body:
Duno if thats allowed or not having set the character ctc parameter and screen at the same time.
(it doesn't matter if the ctc screen is "emtpy" or not)

    define e = Character("Eileen", ctc="click_wait", ctc_position="fixed")
    
    screen ctc():
    
        zorder 100
    
        #add "click_wait"
    
    label start:
    
        e "Hello, world."
    
        return

While running game code:
File "game/script.rpy", line 22, in script

data.title: New GUI improvements suggested by Tutorial 7.
data.body:
- [ ] It would be nice to allow a separate frame images for GUI frames and In-game frames.
- [x] Character should be able to customize the textbox.
- [x] Character probably should be able to deal with arbitrary prefixes. 
- [x] The default button idle color should be much brighter.

data.title: choosing text editor
data.body: I can use neither Editra nor jEdit because when I chose them, there is always an error that my account do not have permission to perform an update. For addition, I am using the newest Renpy, so I honestly don't know what kind of update I need.

data.title: setting config.developer="auto" no longer generates the script_version.txt
data.body:
In 6.99.12.4, if you set config.developer to "auto", the script_version.txt file is never generated, resulting in all games being set in developer mode when end user plays it.
Before I thought was a mistake on my part because I used:
build.classify('**.txt', None)
however even after removing that line, the behavior was still the same. Thanks

data.title: ATL is being reset when hiding a screen with dissolve while using absolute positioning:
data.body:
***It works fine if positioning is supplied directly in transform function...*** (under this simplified example it does, I failed to fix it in the original code by simply replacing absolute values with integers, feels like another equality thing... just this time for tranforms)

```renpy
transform achievements_text(t1, t2, pos):
    subpixel True
    pos pos
    t1
    pause 1
    t2
    
screen test():
    on "hide":
        action With(dissolve)
        
    python:
        t1 = Text("!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!", size=40)
        t2 = Text("???????????????????????", size=40)
        
    add achievements_text(t1, t2, (absolute(300), absolute(30)))
    timer 2.0 action Return()

label start:
    scene black
    call screen test
    pause
```

data.title: Quickmenu disappear after using renpy.retain_after_load()
data.body:
If I define a screen like:
```
screen test():
    textbutton "return" action Return()
```

then write these in script:
```
    "Hello, world."
    $ renpy.retain_after_load()
    call screen test
```

When entering that screen and save game, then go back to main menu and load game, the quickmenu will disappear.

data.title: Changing language doesn't update user defined displayables
data.body:
Version: 6.99.12.4.2187, Linux

When changing language, user defined displayables containing text aren't updated to use the translated strings. 

Code I've used to run a test:
```
image testimage = Text(_("This is original text in image"))
        
label start:
    $ renpy.change_language("other")
    show testimage at truecenter
    "This is original text in game."    
    return
```
After generating a sample translation, this is what I got: [http://imgur.com/B11qn1Pl.png](http://imgur.com/B11qn1Pl.png)

data.title: request config.skipping be documented
data.body: It's handy to be able to programmatically determine if the user is skipping.

data.title: Exception thrown when reloading custom menu screen that takes arguments
data.body:
Description:
If a screen takes arguments and uses 'menu' as a tag, reloading a game while on the screen will cause the game to crash.

This doesn't seem to affect games when Developer Mode is turned off.

Tested on Ren'Py 6.99.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start new game
2. Open a custom menu screen
3. Reload game with shift+r

Example Code:

    init python:
        message = "Hello World"

    screen that_takes_argument(my_arg):
        tag menu
        text my_arg

    screen show_menu_button:
        textbutton "Open Menu Screen" xalign .98 yalign .02 action ShowMenu("that_takes_argument", message)

    define e = Character("Eileen")

    label start:
    
        show screen show_menu_button()
    
        e "You've created a new Ren'Py game."

        e "Once you add a story, pictures, and music, you can release it to the world!"

        return

data.title: Console output crashes (probably unicode bug?)
data.body:
[code]
-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 230, in script
    python:
  File "C:\- indie dev -\games\renpy\renpy\ast.py", line 814, in execute
    renpy.python.py_exec_bytecode(self.code.bytecode, self.hide, store=self.store)
  File "C:\- indie dev -\games\renpy\renpy\python.py", line 1719, in py_exec_bytecode
    exec bytecode in globals, locals
  File "game/script.rpy", line 246, in <module>
    for new_item in rpg.create_token_list(library,[("gen/F_Coal",5,90,15),("gen/R_glittering_dust",5,90,15),("gen/R_animal_blood",5,90,15),("gen/R_animal_feather",5,90,15),("gen/R_sugar",5,90,15),("gen/R_salt",5,90,15),("gen/R_animal_bone",5,90,15),("gen/R_bear_blood",5,90,15),("gen/R_springwater", 5,90,15),("gen/M_copper_ore", 6,90,15),]):
  File "toa_rpg_framework/Core.py", line 84, in create_token_list
  File "toa_rpg_framework/Core.py", line 77, in create_item_token
  File "toa_rpg_framework/Item.py", line 118, in __init__
  File "toa_rpg_framework/Core.py", line 121, in get_reference_item
  File "toa_rpg_framework/Core.py", line 63, in create_item
LookupError: unknown encoding: cp850

Windows-7-6.1.7601-SP1
Ren'Py 6.99.12.4.2187
 0.6.0
[/code]
The line in question is just a simple:
print ("Used class definition for %s" % id_string)
even if I remove that, it crashes with same encoding error a few lines later. Before this was working fine, I think has something to do with unicode support? Thanks

data.title: Add selected option to PlayCharacterVoice()
data.body:
This "selected" option is a simple c&p from the Play() function. Lets say you wanna use PlayCharacterVoice() in your sound preferences screen or like in this example, in the history screen:

    for h in _history_list:
        button action If(h.voice.filename, true=PlayCharacterVoice(h.voice.tag, h.voice.filename), false=None):
            selected (renpy.sound.get_playing(channel="voice") == h.voice.filename)
                vbox:
                    xfill True
                    if h.who:
                        text h.who + '\n' + h.what
                    else:
                        text h.what

This doesn't update the button state properly( dunno if it's the fault because it's in a viewport) but if you scroll
the viewport during the playback the button state gets updated. Missing renpy.restart_interaction?

Anyway, Tom if you have a better solution feel free to change it ;)

data.title: Unnecessary showing of the saybox
data.body:
I have some characters with `window_background=None` ("centered" for example). RenPy shows me empty `saybox` every time, then hides it.
If I do `window hide`, then show text, then `window auto` - all works. But add a lines for EACH character phrase - I think, it's not correct.
P.S. This bug was not present in old GUI
P.P.S. I'd like to see `quick_menu=True/False` parameter in the Character(...)
